p: In this investigation, a bio-guided fractionation of the ethyl acetate (EtOAc) extract of C. taxifolium led to the isolation of ursolic acid ( 5), as the compound responsible for the α-glucosidase inhibition activity. This is an ubiquitous triterpene, well known for its wide spectra of biological activities including anticancer, anti-inflammatory [ 12], antimicrobial [ 13], anti-HIV [ 14], analgesic [ 15], diuretic [ 16], and others [ 17]. Recently, antidiabetic activity of acetyl ursolic acid has been reported [ 18], and the acid triterpene ( 5) had been recognized as an α-glucosidase inhibitor in a series of medicinal plants [ 19] as well a series of derivatives of this acid [ 20].
